intro: Beloperone rohrii var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf beloperone, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. The varietal form, latifolia, is distinguished by its wider leaves compared to the typical form of the species.
